title: Looking Beyond What You See: An Empirical Analysis on Subgroup Intersectional Fairness for Multi-label Chest X-ray Classification Using Social Determinants of Racial Health Inequities
abstract: arXiv:2403.18196v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: There has been significant progress in implementing deep learning models in disease diagnosis using chest X- rays. Despite these advancements, inherent biases in these models can lead to disparities in prediction accuracy across protected groups. In this study, we propose a framework to achieve accurate diagnostic outcomes and ensure fairness across intersectional groups in high-dimensional chest X- ray multi-label classification. Transcending traditional protected attributes, we consider complex interactions within social determinants, enabling a more granular benchmark and evaluation of fairness. We present a simple and robust method that involves retraining the last classification layer of pre-trained models using a balanced dataset across groups. tldr: 通过考虑社会决定因素中的复杂相互作用，提出了一种简单而强大的方法，实现跨受保护群体的准确诊断结果和公平性，为高维胸部X射线多标签分类带来创新。
en_tdlr: A simple and robust method is proposed to achieve accurate diagnostic outcomes and fairness across protected groups by considering complex interactions within social determinants, bringing innovation to high-dimensional chest X-ray multi-label classification.
